ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Writing independent research, applied statistics, working with a research advisor
I had the opportunity to design and implement a senior project/thesis

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the opportunity to implement my own project and write a paper about it. A lot depends on who you have as your advisor, so I think it is important to select carefully. On a course level, it might have been helpful to have gathered the whole course cohort together once or twice and talked about subjects like statistical writing or poster design which aren't often emphasized in other courses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to do independent research, then yes. It can be frustrating and hard if for you, like for me, this is your first time doing independent research.

Yes I would absolutely recommend this course if you are interested in any kind of research (e.g. academia, think tank, Federal Reserve, etc). Here's some advice: (1) the senior essay experience will highly depend on your advisor -  choose one who is responsive to emails and available consistently (even if this is just every other week), (2) stay in clear communication and make sure your expectations align with your advisor - after all, they will be the one assessing the quality of your essay, (3) set checkpoints with your advisor early on so you stay on track.
Yes! I would definitely recommend the ability to do a semester-long project which is well-aligned with your research interests/I personally found it to be a highly rewarding experience.
